intro: Triumfetta pannosa, commonly known as the hairy false mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in racemes. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other well-known plants like hibiscus and cotton. Triumfetta pannosa is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
